lines.text:
[after The Bat has committed a daring crime under the noses of the police]
Get me Detective Anderson! No cheap crook is going to make a monkey out of me and get away with it!

[in terror]
The Bat!
Now what on Earth are you doing?
I'm setting a bear trap for the Bat, incase he decides to come flying around here.
[throws a trap on a chain out the window]
And I've got the other end fastened to the bed.
Who did that?
I don't know... this house gets on my nerves, they won't let me sleep.
Don't trust him, caretaker means servant... Bat!
Who won't let you sleep?

The ghosts... he slams doors, and there's no one there to slam them... he opens windows, and I can't see nothing... he rolls things down the stairs, and there's no one there to make them roll... that ain't all, he whispers to me, from behind the wall.
[a loud scream is heard]
Listen, he's here again... stay here long enough, you'll see.
Let's go back to the city.
That new gardener, I don't like his looks, suppose'n he's the Bat?
I know he's not a gardener, because uticaria is hives, rubeola is measles, and alopecia is baldness.
And knowing all this, you're going to let him stay here?
I will, until I find out why my niece brought him here.
Did you do much looking around?
Did I? That's just what I was doing when somebody socked me with a piano.
We didn't mean to fool you, auntie.
You didn't... gardeners don't have manicured fingernails.
We'll get to the bottom of this. I've sent for detectives.
Detectives won't do no good. The entire police force won't do no good.
[nervous laugh]
They can't stop ghosts.
You should persuade your aunt to leave this house.
Give me those blueprints!

[Anderson picks up a gun after Fleming is killed]
Why that's my revolver!

[inspects it]
One shot fired.
I fired that shot myself last night.
Nice try, Miss Van Gorder, but I'm placing your niece under arrest for the murder of Courtleigh Fleming.
You can't arrest her without a coroner's verdict, and you'll have to wait on Dr. Vanrees for that.
Miss Van Gorder, when I find a need to make an arrest, I'll make it! And I won't wait for any coroner's verdict.
Hey, what type of joint is this?
Who are you?
Who am I? Who do you think I am? W.T. Jones. Super-sleuth of Oakdale County.
Auntie... That painting moved!
I just saw Banker Fleming on the roof!
I don't like that doctor. One look at him would cure anybody!
He's coming! The Bat is coming down the stairs!
It's been a long chase, Mister Bat. But we've got you. We've got you red-handed!

[after The Bat gets trapped in her bear trap outside]
I caught The Bat! I caught The Bat! I caught The Bat! I caught The Bat!
Aren't you going to take me up with you?
You're nothing but trouble on the ground floor, you'll be a nuisance on the roof.
[goes up the stairs]
If I yell you come up!
Who, me?
Yes you!
Dale, get some whiskey.
You mean to tell me you've got booze in the house?
Yes, for emergencies.
So that's why everybody's trying to break into this place.
Get the Ouija board.
It's got the Bible on top of it, keeping it quiet.
Sorry, Auntie, the train was late. But nice Mr. Fleming was good enough to give me a ride from the station.
I should think the less you have to do with Richard Fleming, the better.
Oh, but why, Auntie?
I don't like him, he leased this house to me.
What I'd like to know is how did you get the dope from headquarters on this case?
The same way I get everything, with my mind. I've got the greatest brain that ever existed.
